owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Tyrothricin is a mixture of antibiotics including tyrocidines and gramicidins, isolated from Bacillus brevis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tyrothricin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Tyrothricin is a mixture of antibiotics including tyrocidines and gramicidins, isolated from Bacillus brevis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Brodimoprim is a structural derivative of trimethoprim and an inhibitor of bacterial dihydrofolate reductase. The 4-methoxy group of trimethoprim is replaced with a bromine atom.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: brodimoprim

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Brodimoprim is a structural derivative of trimethoprim and an inhibitor of bacterial dihydrofolate reductase. The 4-methoxy group of trimethoprim is replaced with a bromine atom.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cephems have a six-membered dihydrothiazine ring with a sulfur atom and double bond fused with its beta-lactam ring. This group includes the cephalosporins and cephamycins, the latter containing an additional alpha-methoxy group.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cephem

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfonamides are broad spectrum, synthetic antibiotics that contain the sulfonamide group. Sulfonamides inhibit dihydropteroate synthase, which catalyzes the conversion of p-aminobenzoic acid to dihydropteroic acid as part of the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthetic pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor of many nucleotides and amino acids. Many sulfamides are taken with trimethoprim, an inhibitor of dihydrofolate reductase, also disturbing the trihydrofolic acid synthesis pathway.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfonamide antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfonamides are broad spectrum, synthetic antibiotics that contain the sulfonamide group. Sulfonamides inhibit dihydropteroate synthase, which catalyzes the conversion of p-aminobenzoic acid to dihydropteroic acid as part of the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthetic pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor of many nucleotides and amino acids. Many sulfamides are taken with trimethoprim, an inhibitor of dihydrofolate reductase, also disturbing the trihydrofolic acid synthesis pathway.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Tetroxoprim is a trimethoprim derivative that inhibits bacterial dihydrofolate reductase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tetroxoprim

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Tetroxoprim is a trimethoprim derivative that inhibits bacterial dihydrofolate reductase.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfadiazine is a potent inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfadiazine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfadiazine is a potent inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfadimidine is an alkaline sulfonamide antibiotic that inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, and enzyme in the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis pathway. This interferes with the production of folate, which is a precursor to many amino acids and nucleotides.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfadimidine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfadimidine is an alkaline sulfonamide antibiotic that inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, and enzyme in the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis pathway. This interferes with the production of folate, which is a precursor to many amino acids and nucleotides.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfadoxine is an inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfadoxine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfadoxine is an inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfamethoxazole is a sulfonamide antibiotic usually taken with trimethoprim, a diaminopyrimidine antibiotic. Sulfamethoxazole inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, essential to tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis. This pathway generates compounds used in the synthesis of many amino acids and nucleotides.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfamethoxazole

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfamethoxazole is a sulfonamide antibiotic usually taken with trimethoprim, a diaminopyrimidine antibiotic. Sulfamethoxazole inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, essential to tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis. This pathway generates compounds used in the synthesis of many amino acids and nucleotides.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfisoxazole is an inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfisoxazole

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfisoxazole is an inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Iclaprim is a bactericidal compound that inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. It is used against clinically important Gram-positive pathogens, including methicillin-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus and methicillin-resistant S. aureus.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: iclaprim

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Iclaprim is a bactericidal compound that inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. It is used against clinically important Gram-positive pathogens, including methicillin-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus and methicillin-resistant S. aureus.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Azidamfenicol is a water soluble derivative of chloramphenicol, sharing the same mode of action of inhibiting peptide synthesis by interacting with the 23S RNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: azidamfenicol

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Azidamfenicol is a water soluble derivative of chloramphenicol, sharing the same mode of action of inhibiting peptide synthesis by interacting with the 23S RNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Chloramphenicol is a bacteriostatic antimicrobial originally derived from the bacterium Streptomyces venezuelae. It was the first antibiotic to be manufactured synthetically on a large scale. It functions by inhibiting peptidyl transferase activity of the bacterial ribosome, binding to A2451 and A2452 residues in the 23S rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit and preventing peptide bond formation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: chloramphenicol

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Chloramphenicol is a bacteriostatic antimicrobial originally derived from the bacterium Streptomyces venezuelae. It was the first antibiotic to be manufactured synthetically on a large scale. It functions by inhibiting peptidyl transferase activity of the bacterial ribosome, binding to A2451 and A2452 residues in the 23S rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit and preventing peptide bond formation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Phenicols are broad spectrum bacteriostatic antibiotics acting on bacterial protein synthesis. More specifically, the phenicols block peptide elongation by binding to the peptidyltansferase centre of the 70S ribosome.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: phenicol antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Phenicols are broad spectrum bacteriostatic antibiotics acting on bacterial protein synthesis. More specifically, the phenicols block peptide elongation by binding to the peptidyltansferase centre of the 70S ribosome.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Polymyxin B is mixture of mostly polymyxins B1 and B2, mainly used for resistant gram-negative infections. They are polypeptides with cationic detergent action on cell membranes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymyxin B

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polymyxin B is mixture of mostly polymyxins B1 and B2, mainly used for resistant gram-negative infections. They are polypeptides with cationic detergent action on cell membranes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Derivative of Chloramphenicol. The nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: thiamphenicol

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Derivative of Chloramphenicol. The nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3).

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Florfenicol is a fluorine derivative of chloramphenicol, where the nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3) and the hydroxyl group (-OH), by a fluorine group (-F). The action mechanism is the same as chloramphenicol's, where the antibiotic binds to the 23S RNA of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes to inhibit protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: florfenicol

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Florfenicol is a fluorine derivative of chloramphenicol, where the nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3) and the hydroxyl group (-OH), by a fluorine group (-F). The action mechanism is the same as chloramphenicol's, where the antibiotic binds to the 23S RNA of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes to inhibit protein synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Dalbavancin is a semisynthetic second-generation lipoglycopeptide derived from teicoplanin. It binds to the D-Ala-D-Ala terminus of peptidoglycan precursors. It is used to treat Gram-positive bacteria and can be used to treat methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus and vancomycin-resistant enterococci.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: dalbavancin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Dalbavancin is a semisynthetic second-generation lipoglycopeptide derived from teicoplanin. It binds to the D-Ala-D-Ala terminus of peptidoglycan precursors. It is used to treat Gram-positive bacteria and can be used to treat methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus and vancomycin-resistant enterococci.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Telavancin is a semi-synthetic derivative of vancomycin and is a second-generation lipoglycopeptide antibiotic. Telavancin inhibits cell wall synthesis by forming a complex with the D-Ala-D-Ala terminus of peptidoglycan precursors and preventing transglycosylation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: telavancin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Telavancin is a semi-synthetic derivative of vancomycin and is a second-generation lipoglycopeptide antibiotic. Telavancin inhibits cell wall synthesis by forming a complex with the D-Ala-D-Ala terminus of peptidoglycan precursors and preventing transglycosylation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Tuberactinomycins are a family of cyclic peptide antibiotics that are important in the treatment of tuberculosis. Tuberactinomycins contain nonproteinogenic amino acids and inhibit group I self-splicing RNA to disrupt prokaryotic protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tuberactinomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Tuberactinomycins are a family of cyclic peptide antibiotics that are important in the treatment of tuberculosis. Tuberactinomycins contain nonproteinogenic amino acids and inhibit group I self-splicing RNA to disrupt prokaryotic protein synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ethambutol is an antimycobacterial drug prescribed to treat tuberculosis. It is usually given in combination with other tuberculosis drugs, such as isoniazid, rifampicin, and pyrazinamide. Ethambutol inhibits arabinosyl biosynthesis, disrupting mycobacterial cell wall formation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ethambutol

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ethambutol is an antimycobacterial drug prescribed to treat tuberculosis. It is usually given in combination with other tuberculosis drugs, such as isoniazid, rifampicin, and pyrazinamide. Ethambutol inhibits arabinosyl biosynthesis, disrupting mycobacterial cell wall formation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Rifaximin is a semi-synthetic rifamycin used to treat traveller's diarrhea. Rifaximin inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to the beta subunit of bacterial RNA polymerase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rifaximin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Rifaximin is a semi-synthetic rifamycin used to treat traveller's diarrhea. Rifaximin inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to the beta subunit of bacterial RNA polymerase.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Isoniazid is an organic compound that is the first-line anti tuberculosis medication in prevention and treatment. As a prodrug, it is activated by mycobacterial catalase-peroxidases such as M. tuberculosis KatG. Isoniazid inhibits mycolic acid synthesis, which prevents cell wall synthesis in mycobacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: isoniazid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Isoniazid is an organic compound that is the first-line anti tuberculosis medication in prevention and treatment. As a prodrug, it is activated by mycobacterial catalase-peroxidases such as M. tuberculosis KatG. Isoniazid inhibits mycolic acid synthesis, which prevents cell wall synthesis in mycobacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A40926 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Nonomuraea sp. ATCC 39727. It is precusor of the second-generation glycopeptide antibiotic dalbavancin.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic A40926

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A40926 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Nonomuraea sp. ATCC 39727. It is precusor of the second-generation glycopeptide antibiotic dalbavancin.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Polyamine antibiotics are organic compounds having two or more primary amino groups.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polyamine antibiotic

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Chlortetracycline was an early, first-generation tetracycline antibiotic developed in the 1940's. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S subunit of bacterial ribosomes, preventing the aminoacyl-tRNA from binding to the ribosome.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: chlortetracycline

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Chlortetracycline was an early, first-generation tetracycline antibiotic developed in the 1940's. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S subunit of bacterial ribosomes, preventing the aminoacyl-tRNA from binding to the ribosome.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Rifabutin is a semisynthetic rifamycin used in tuberculosis therapy. It inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rifabutin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Rifabutin is a semisynthetic rifamycin used in tuberculosis therapy. It inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Rifapentine is a semisynthetic rifamycin that inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis. It is often used in the treatment of tuberculosis and leprosy.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rifapentine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Rifapentine is a semisynthetic rifamycin that inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis. It is often used in the treatment of tuberculosis and leprosy.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Aztreonam was the first monobactam discovered, and is greatly effective against Gram-negative bacteria while inactive against Gram-positive bacteria. Artreonam is a poor substrate for beta-lactamases, and may even act as an inhibitor. In Gram-negative bacteria, Aztreonam interferes with filamentation, inhibiting cell division and leading to cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: aztreonam

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Aztreonam was the first monobactam discovered, and is greatly effective against Gram-negative bacteria while inactive against Gram-positive bacteria. In Gram-negative bacteria, Aztreonam interferes with filamentation, inhibiting cell division and leading to cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Organoarsenic antibiotics are arsenic-containing compounds with antibacterial effects. The organoarsenic antibiotic arsphenamine and its derivatives were developed in the 1910s as the first modern chemotherapeutic agents.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: organoarsenic antibiotic

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Arsphenamine, also known as Salvarsan and 606, is a drug that was used beginning in the 1910s to treat syphilis and trypanosomiasis. It is an organoarsenic compound and was the first modern chemotherapeutic agent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: arsphenamine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Arsphenamine, also known as Salvarsan and 606, is a drug that was used beginning in the 1910s to treat syphilis and trypanosomiasis. It is an organoarsenic compound and was the first modern chemotherapeutic agent.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Mupirocin, also known as pseudomonic acid, is a bacteriostatic polyketide antibiotic from Pseudomonas fluorescens used to treat S. aureus and MRSA. It inhibits Ile tRNA synthetase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mupirocin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Mupirocin, also known as pseudomonic acid, is a bacteriostatic polyketide antibiotic from Pseudomonas fluorescens used to treat S. aureus and MRSA. It inhibits Ile tRNA synthetase.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pristinamycin 1A is a type B streptogramin antibiotic produced by Streptomyces pristinaespiralis. It binds to the P site of the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome, preventing the extension of protein chains.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pristinamycin IA

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Quinupristin is a type B streptogramin and a semisynthetic derivative of pristinamycin 1A. It is a component of the drug Synercid and interacts with the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome to inhibit protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: quinupristin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Quinupristin is a type B streptogramin and a semisynthetic derivative of pristinamycin 1A. It is a component of the drug Synercid and interacts with the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome to inhibit protein synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pulvomycin is a polyketide antibiotic that binds elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu) to inhibit protein biosynthesis by preventing the formation of the ternary complex (EF-Tu*GTP*aa-tRNA). Phenotypically, it was shown that pulvomycin sensitivity is dominant over resistance.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pulvomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pulvomycin is a polyketide antibiotic that binds elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu) to inhibit protein biosynthesis by preventing the formation of the ternary complex (EF-Tu*GTP*aa-tRNA). Phenotypically, it was shown that pulvomycin sensitivity is dominant over resistance.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Colistin A, or polymyxin E1, has a 6-octanoic acid lipid tail. Polymyxins disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: colistin A

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Colistin A, or polymyxin E1, has a 6-octanoic acid lipid tail. Polymyxins disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Colistin B, or polymyxin E2, has a 6-heptanoic acid lipid tail. Polymyxins disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: colistin B

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Colistin B, or polymyxin E2, has a 6-heptanoic acid lipid tail. Polymyxins disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Polymyxin B1 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a 6-methyloctanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymyxin B1

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polymyxin B1 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a 6-methyloctanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Polymyxin B2 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a 6-methylheptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymyxin B2

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polymyxin B2 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a 6-methylheptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Polymyxin B3 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with an octanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymyxin B3

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polymyxin B3 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with an octanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Polymyxin B4 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a heptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymyxin B4

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polymyxin B4 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a heptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bacitracin A is the primary component of bacitracin. It contains many uncommon amino acids and interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bacitracin A

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bacitracin A is the primary component of bacitracin. It contains many uncommon amino acids and interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bacitracin B is a component of bacitracin, an antibiotic mixture that interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis. It differs from Bacitracin A with a valine instead of an isoleucine in its peptide.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bacitracin B

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bacitracin B is a component of bacitracin, an antibiotic mixture that interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis. It differs from Bacitracin A with a valine instead of an isoleucine in its peptide.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bacitracin F is a component of bacitracin, an antibiotic mixture that interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis. It is formed when the thiazoline ring of bacitracin A is oxidatively deaminated.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bacitracin F

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bacitracin F is a component of bacitracin, an antibiotic mixture that interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis. It is formed when the thiazoline ring of bacitracin A is oxidatively deaminated.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Benzylpenicillin, commonly referred to as penicillin G, is effective against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. It is unstable in acid.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: benzylpenicillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Benzylpenicillin, commonly referred to as penicillin G, is effective against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. It is unstable in acid.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Phenoxymethylpenicillin, or penicillin V, is a penicillin derivative that is acid stable but less active than benzylpenicillin (penicillin G).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: phenoxymethylpenicillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Phenoxymethylpenicillin, or penicillin V, is a penicillin derivative that is acid stable but less active than benzylpenicillin (penicillin G).

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Propicillin is an orally taken penicillin derivative that has high absorption but poor activity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: propicillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Propicillin is an orally taken penicillin derivative that has high absorption but poor activity.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Dicloxacillin is a penicillin derivative that has an extra chlorine atom in comparison to cloxacillin. While more active than cloxacillin, its high affinity for serum protein reduces its activity in human serum in vitro.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: dicloxacillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Dicloxacillin is a penicillin derivative that has an extra chlorine atom in comparison to cloxacillin. While more active than cloxacillin, its high affinity for serum protein reduces its activity in human serum in vitro.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Flucloxacillin is similar to cloxacillin, with an extra additional fluorine atom.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: flucloxacillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Flucloxacillin is similar to cloxacillin, with an extra additional fluorine atom.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ampicillin is a penicillin derivative that is highly acid stable, with its activity similar to benzylpenicillin.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ampicillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ampicillin is a penicillin derivative that is highly acid stable, with its activity similar to benzylpenicillin.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Azlocillin is a semisynthetic derivative of penicillin that is notably active against Ps. aeruginosa and other Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: azlocillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Azlocillin is a semisynthetic derivative of penicillin that is notably active against Ps. aeruginosa and other Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Mezlocillin is a penicillin derivative taken parenterally.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mezlocillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Mezlocillin is a penicillin derivative taken parenterally.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Doripenem is a carbapenem with a broad range of activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, and along with meropenem, it is the most active beta-lactam antibiotic against Pseudomonas aeruginosa. It inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: doripenem

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Doripenem is a carbapenem with a broad range of activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, and along with meropenem, it is the most active beta-lactam antibiotic against Pseudomonas aeruginosa. It inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefalexin is a cephalosporin antibiotic that causes filamentation. It is resistant to staphylococcal beta-lactamase, but degraded by enterobacterial beta-lactamases.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefalexin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefalexin is a cephalosporin antibiotic that causes filamentation. It is resistant to staphylococcal beta-lactamase, but degraded by enterobacterial beta-lactamases.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefadroxil, or p-hydroxycephalexin, is an cephalosporin antibiotic similar to cefalexin.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefadroxil

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefadroxil, or p-hydroxycephalexin, is an cephalosporin antibiotic similar to cefalexin.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefotiam is a cephalosporin antibiotic with similar activity to cefuroxime but more active against enterobacteria. It is consumed orally as the prodrug cefotiam hexetil.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefotiam

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefotiam is a cephalosporin antibiotic with similar activity to cefuroxime but more active against enterobacteria. It is consumed orally as the prodrug cefotiam hexetil.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefaclor is a semisynthetic cephalosporin derived from cephalexin. It has broad-spectrum antibiotic activity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefaclor

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefaclor is a semisynthetic cephalosporin derived from cephalexin. It has broad-spectrum antibiotic activity.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefotaxime is a semisynthetic cephalosporin taken parenterally. It is resistant to most beta-lactamases and active against Gram-negative rods and cocci due to its aminothiazoyl and methoximino functional groups.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefotaxime

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefotaxime is a semisynthetic cephalosporin taken parenterally. It is resistant to most beta-lactamases and active against Gram-negative rods and cocci due to its aminothiazoyl and methoximino functional groups.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefixime is a cephalosporin resistant to most beta-lactamases. It is active against many enterobacteria, but activity against staphylococci is poor.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefixime

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefixime is a cephalosporin resistant to most beta-lactamases. It is active against many enterobacteria, but activity against staphylococci is poor.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefpodoxime is a semisynthetic cephalosporin that acts similarly to cefotaxime with broad-spectrum activity. It is stable to many plasmid-mediated beta-lactamses. Cefpodoxime is consumed as the prodrug cefpodoxime proxetil.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefpodoxime

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefpodoxime is a semisynthetic cephalosporin that acts similarly to cefotaxime with broad-spectrum activity. It is stable to many plasmid-mediated beta-lactamses. Cefpodoxime is consumed as the prodrug cefpodoxime proxetil.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ceftibuten is a semisynthetic cephalosporin active against Gram-negative bacilli. It is resistant against many plasmid-mediated beta-lactamases.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ceftibuten

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ceftibuten is a semisynthetic cephalosporin active against Gram-negative bacilli. It is resistant against many plasmid-mediated beta-lactamases.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefditoren is a semisynthetic cephalosporin active against staphylococci, streptococci, and and most enterobacteria. It is resistant to staphylococcal and most enterobacterial beta-lactamases, and is usually taken as the prodrug cefditoren pivoxil.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefditoren

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefditoren is a semisynthetic cephalosporin active against staphylococci, streptococci, and and most enterobacteria. It is resistant to staphylococcal and most enterobacterial beta-lactamases, and is usually taken as the prodrug cefditoren pivoxil.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefdinir is similar to cefixime with a modified side-chain at its 7-amino position. It also shares similar activity with cefixime but is more active against staphylococci. It has also be shown to enhance phagocytosis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefdinir

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefdinir is similar to cefixime with a modified side-chain at its 7-amino position. It also shares similar activity with cefixime but is more active against staphylococci. It has also be shown to enhance phagocytosis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ceftaroline is a novel cephalosporin active against methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus. Like other cephalosporins it binds penicillin-binding proteins to inhibit cell wall synthesis. It strongly binds with PBP2a, associated with methicillin resistance. It is taken orally as the prodrug ceftaroline fosamil.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ceftaroline

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ceftaroline is a novel cephalosporin active against methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus. Like other cephalosporins it binds penicillin-binding proteins to inhibit cell wall synthesis. It strongly binds with PBP2a, associated with methicillin resistance. It is taken orally as the prodrug ceftaroline fosamil.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A semi-synthetic derivative of gentamicin B (hydroxyamino propionyl genamicin B). It is modified to combat microbial inactivation and has a slightly larger spectrum of activity compared to other aminoglycosides, including Ser marcescens, Enterobacteria, and K pneumoniae.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: isepamicin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A semi-synthetic derivative of gentamicin B (hydroxyamino propionyl genamicin B). It is modified to combat microbial inactivation and has a slightly larger spectrum of activity compared to other aminoglycosides, including Ser marcescens, Enterobacteria, and K pneumoniae.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A gentamicin class aminoglycoside antibiotic often used in mammalian cell culture work as a selectable marker for the neo cassette (APH3').
owl:Class.rdfs:label: G418

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gentamicin class aminoglycoside antibiotic often used in mammalian cell culture work as a selectable marker for the neo cassette (APH3').

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A synthetic derivative (1-N-(4-amino-2-hydroxybutyryl) of dibekacin used in Japan. It is active against methicillin-resistant Staph. aureus and shows synergy with ampicillin when treating gentamicin and vancomycin resistant enterocci.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: arbekacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A synthetic derivative (1-N-(4-amino-2-hydroxybutyryl) of dibekacin used in Japan. It is active against methicillin-resistant Staph. aureus and shows synergy with ampicillin when treating gentamicin and vancomycin resistant enterocci.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Gentamicin B is a semisynthetic aminoglycoside antibacterial.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gentamicin B

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Gentamicin B is a semisynthetic aminoglycoside antibacterial.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used for the treatment of parasitic infections. It is similar to neomycin sharing a similar spectrum of activity, but its hydroxyl group at the 6'-position instead of an amino group makes it resistant to AAC(6') modifying enzymes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: paromomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used for the treatment of parasitic infections. It is similar to neomycin sharing a similar spectrum of activity, but its hydroxyl group at the 6'-position instead of an amino group makes it resistant to AAC(6') modifying enzymes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Lividomycins are aminoglycosidic antibiotics produced by Streptomyces lividus. They contain 2-amino-2,3-dideoxy-D-glucose.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lividomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Lividomycins are aminoglycosidic antibiotics produced by Streptomyces lividus. They contain 2-amino-2,3-dideoxy-D-glucose.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Gatifloxacin is an 8-methoxy, 7-piperazinyl, 6-fluoroquinolone that can be taken orally or by intravenous administration. It is active against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, but inactive against non-fermenting Gram-negative rods including Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gatifloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Gatifloxacin is an 8-methoxy, 7-piperazinyl, 6-fluoroquinolone that can be taken orally or by intravenous administration. It is active against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, but inactive against non-fermenting Gram-negative rods including Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Lomefloxacin is a difluoropiperazinyl quinolone, sharing similar activities with other fluoroquinolones. It is used to treat urinary tract infections. Relative to other fluoroquinolones, it has a longer half life and has higher serum concentrations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lomefloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Lomefloxacin is a difluoropiperazinyl quinolone, sharing similar activities with other fluoroquinolones. It is used to treat urinary tract infections. Relative to other fluoroquinolones, it has a longer half life and has higher serum concentrations.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Nalidixic acid is a quinolone derivative of naphthyridine active against many enterobacteria, but ineffective against Ps aeruginosa, Gram-positive bacteria, and anaerobes. Acquired resistance is common in nalidixic acid treatments.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nalidixic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Nalidixic acid is a quinolone derivative of naphthyridine active against many enterobacteria, but ineffective against Ps aeruginosa, Gram-positive bacteria, and anaerobes. Acquired resistance is common in nalidixic acid treatments.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Norfloxacin is a 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a wide range of activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is inactive against most anaerobes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: norfloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Norfloxacin is a 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a wide range of activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is inactive against most anaerobes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ofloxacin is a 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a methyl-substituted oxazine ring. It has a broad spectrum of activity including many enterobacteria and mycoplasma but most anaerobes are resistant.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ofloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ofloxacin is a 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a methyl-substituted oxazine ring. It has a broad spectrum of activity including many enterobacteria and mycoplasma but most anaerobes are resistant.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Trovafloxacin is a trifluoroquinalone with a broad spectrum of activity that acts by inhibiting the uncoiling of supercoiled DNA. While potent against many Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, it is less active against pseudomonads and Cl. difficile. It is usually taken as the prodrug trovafloxacin mesylate or alatrofloxacin mesylate for oral or intravenous administration, respectively.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: trovafloxacin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Grepafloxacin is a broad-spectrum antibacterial quinoline. It is no longer taken due to its high toxicity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: grepafloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Grepafloxacin is a broad-spectrum antibacterial quinoline. It is no longer taken due to its high toxicity.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sparfloxacin is a dimethylpiperazinyl difluoroquinolone that acts by inhibiting DNA gyrase. It is active against aerobic Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, as well as some mycobacteria. It has moderate activity against some anaerobes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sparfloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sparfloxacin is a dimethylpiperazinyl difluoroquinolone that acts by inhibiting DNA gyrase. It is active against aerobic Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, as well as some mycobacteria. It has moderate activity against some anaerobes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Demeclocycline is a tetracycline analog with 7-chloro and 6-methyl groups. Due to its fast absorption and slow excretion, it maintains higher effective blood levels compared to other tetracyclines.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: demeclocycline

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Demeclocycline is a tetracycline analog with 7-chloro and 6-methyl groups. Due to its fast absorption and slow excretion, it maintains higher effective blood levels compared to other tetracyclines.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Oxytetracycline is a derivative of tetracycline with a 5-hydroxyl group. Its activity is similar to other tetracyclines.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: oxytetracycline

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Oxytetracycline is a derivative of tetracycline with a 5-hydroxyl group. Its activity is similar to other tetracyclines.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pristinamycin IIA is a streptogramin A antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pristinamycin IIA

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pristinamycin IIA is a streptogramin A antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pleuromutilins are natural fungal products that target bacterial protein translation by binding the the 23S rRNA, blocking the ribosome P site at the 50S subunit. They are mostly used for agriculture and veterinary purposes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pleuromutilin antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pleuromutilins are natural fungal products that target bacterial protein translation by binding the the 23S rRNA, blocking the ribosome P site at the 50S subunit. They are mostly used for agriculture and veterinary purposes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Tiamulin is a pleuromutilin derivative currently used in veterinary medicine. It binds to the 23 rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit to inhibit protein translation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tiamulin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Tiamulin is a pleuromutilin derivative currently used in veterinary medicine. It binds to the 23 rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit to inhibit protein translation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Madumycin II is a streptogramin A antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: madumycin II

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Madumycin II is a streptogramin A antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Griseoviridin is a streptogramin A antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: griseoviridin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Griseoviridin is a streptogramin A antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Dalfopristin is a water-soluble semi-synthetic derivative of pristinamycin IIA. It is produced by Streptomyces pristinaespiralis and is used in combination with quinupristin in a 7:3 ratio. Both work together to inhibit protein synthesis, and is active against Gram-positive bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: dalfopristin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Dalfopristin is a water-soluble semi-synthetic derivative of pristinamycin IIA. It is produced by Streptomyces pristinaespiralis and is used in combination with quinupristin in a 7:3 ratio. Both work together to inhibit protein synthesis, and is active against Gram-positive bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pristinamycin IB is a class B streptogramin similar to pristinamycin IA, the former containing a N-methyl-4-(methylamino)phenylalanine instead of a N-methyl-4-(dimethylamino)phenylalanine in its class A streptogramin counterpart (one less methyl group).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pristinamycin IB

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pristinamycin IB is a class B streptogramin similar to pristinamycin IA, the former containing a N-methyl-4-(methylamino)phenylalanine instead of a N-methyl-4-(dimethylamino)phenylalanine in its class A streptogramin counterpart (one less methyl group).

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Virginiamycin S2 is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: virginiamycin S2

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Virginiamycin S2 is a streptogramin B antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Vernamycin B-gamma is a class B streptogramin derived from virginiamycin S1.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: vernamycin B-gamma

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Vernamycin B-gamma is a class B streptogramin derived from virginiamycin S1.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Vernamycin C is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: vernamycin C

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Vernamycin C is a streptogramin B antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Patricin A is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: patricin A

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Patricin A is a streptogramin B antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Patricin B is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: patricin B

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Patricin B is a streptogramin B antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ostreogrycin B3 is a derivative of pristinamycin IA, with an additional 3-hydroxy group on its 4-oxopipecolic acid.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ostreogrycin B3

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ostreogrycin B3 is a derivative of pristinamycin IA, with an additional 3-hydroxy group on its 4-oxopipecolic acid.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfacetamide is a very soluable sulfonamide antibiotic previously used to treat urinary tract infections. Its relatively low activity and toxicity to those with Stevens-Johnson syndrome have reduced its use and availability.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfacetamide

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfacetamide is a very soluable sulfonamide antibiotic previously used to treat urinary tract infections. Its relatively low activity and toxicity to those with Stevens-Johnson syndrome have reduced its use and availability.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Mafenide is a sulfonamide used topically for treating burns.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mafenide

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Mafenide is a sulfonamide used topically for treating burns.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Arylomycins are lipopeptide antibiotics, sharing a lipohexapeptide with a C-terminal tripeptide macrolide and varying by the length of its alkyl chains.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: arylomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Arylomycins are lipopeptide antibiotics, sharing a lipohexapeptide with a C-terminal tripeptide macrolide and varying by the length of its alkyl chains.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Thiostrepton is a cyclic peptide active against Gram-positive bacteria. It is produced by streptomyces bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: thiostrepton

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Thiostrepton is a cyclic peptide active against Gram-positive bacteria. It is produced by streptomyces bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Moemomycin antibiotics are phosphoglycolipids that contain a 3-phosphoglyceric acid, often used as a mixture. They inhibit petidoglycan glycosyltransferases to prevent bacterial cell wall biosynthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: moenomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Moemomycin antibiotics are phosphoglycolipids that contain a 3-phosphoglyceric acid, often used as a mixture. They inhibit petidoglycan glycosyltransferases to prevent bacterial cell wall biosynthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Furazolidone is a nitrofuran antibiotic that is a non-ionic synthetic compound. It is taken orally and is active against many enteric pathogens. Furazolidone also has antiprotozoal activity and acts by inhibiting monoamine oxidase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: furazolidone

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Furazolidone is a nitrofuran antibiotic that is a non-ionic synthetic compound. It is taken orally and is active against many enteric pathogens. Furazolidone also has antiprotozoal activity and acts by inhibiting monoamine oxidase.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Metronidazole is a nitroimidazole that is active against anaerobic bacteria and protozoa. It is not effective against aerobic bacteria. Nitroimidazoles act by oxidizing DNA causing strand breaks and cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: metronidazole

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Metronidazole is a nitroimidazole that is active against anaerobic bacteria and protozoa. It is not effective against aerobic bacteria. Nitroimidazoles act by oxidizing DNA causing strand breaks and cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bleomycinic acid is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bleomycinic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bleomycinic acid is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bleomycin A2 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bleomycin A2

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bleomycin A2 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bleomycin B2 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bleomycin B2

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bleomycin B2 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Defensins are natural cationic peptides that have antibiotic properties. It is part of the innate immune system of plants and animals.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: defensin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Defensins are natural cationic peptides that have antibiotic properties. It is part of the innate immune system of plants and animals.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Magainins are antimicrobial peptides produced by amphibians skil cells as part of their innate immune system. It is active against a broad range of gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria, fungi and protozoa.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: magainin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Magainins are antimicrobial peptides produced by amphibians skil cells as part of their innate immune system. It is active against a broad range of gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria, fungi and protozoa.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Actinomycins are peptide antibiotics that interact with DNA. This prevents RNA synthesis, thus preventing the production of proteins vital to the cell.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: actinomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Actinomycins are peptide antibiotics that interact with DNA. This prevents RNA synthesis, thus preventing the production of proteins vital to the cell.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Dactinomycin, also known as Actinomycin D, is a cyclic peptide antibiotic that interacts with DNA to inhibit RNA synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dactinomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Dactinomycin, also known as Actinomycin D, is a cyclic peptide antibiotic that interacts with DNA to inhibit RNA synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Moenomycin A1 is a major component of moenomycin mixtures. It is produced by Streptomyces ghanaensis, S. bambergiensis, S. ederensis, and S. geysiriensis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: moenomycin A1

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Moenomycin A1 is a major component of moenomycin mixtures. It is produced by Streptomyces ghanaensis, S. bambergiensis, S. ederensis, and S. geysiriensis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfasalazine is a derivative of the early sulfonamide sulfapyridine (salicylazosulfapyridine). It was developed to increase water solubility and is taken orally for ulcerative colitis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfasalazine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfasalazine is a derivative of the early sulfonamide sulfapyridine (salicylazosulfapyridine). It was developed to increase water solubility and is taken orally for ulcerative colitis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sulfamethizole is a short-acting sulfonamide that inhibits dihydropteroate synthetase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfamethizole

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sulfamethizole is a short-acting sulfonamide that inhibits dihydropteroate synthetase.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Lividomycin A is a pentasaccharide antibiotic which interferes with bacterial protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lividomycin A

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Lividomycin A is a pentasaccharide antibiotic which interferes with bacterial protein synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Lividomycin B is a derivative of lividomycin A with a removed mannose group (demannosyllividomycin A). Livodomycins interfere with bacterial protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lividomycin B

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Lividomycin B is a derivative of lividomycin A with a removed mannose group (demannosyllividomycin A). Livodomycins interfere with bacterial protein synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefalotin is a semisynthetic cephalosporin antibiotic activate against staphylococci. It is resistant to staphylococci beta-lactamases but hydrolyzed by enterobacterial beta-lactamases.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefalotin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefalotin is a semisynthetic cephalosporin antibiotic activate against staphylococci. It is resistant to staphylococci beta-lactamases but hydrolyzed by enterobacterial beta-lactamases.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Isopenicillin N is a natural penicillin derivative produced by Penicillium chrysogenum with activity similar to penicillin N.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: isopenicillin N

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Isopenicillin N is a natural penicillin derivative produced by Penicillium chrysogenum with activity similar to penicillin N.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Penicillin N is a penicillin derivative produced by Cephalosporium acremonium.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: penicillin N

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Penicillin N is a penicillin derivative produced by Cephalosporium acremonium.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Mixtures of antibiotics are commonly used clinically. These mixtures link to antibiotic molecules that are also listed in their respective families under antibiotic molecules. i.e. 'Gramicidin A' is part of the mixture 'gramicidin D', while 'Gramicidin A' is also a 'gramicidin', which is a 'peptide antibiotic'.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic mixture

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Antibiotic targets are components of the bacterial cell usually unique to bacteria or significantly different from their eukaryotic counterparts to allow for selective antibacterial activity. Exceptions include antibiotics that are converted to an active form inside the bacterium. Resistance mechanisms may modify these targets to protect bacteria from the effects of antibiotics.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Antibiotic targets are components of the bacterial cell usually unique to bacteria or significantly different from their eukaryotic counterparts to allow for selective antibacterial activity. Exceptions include antibiotics that are converted to an active form inside the bacterium. Resistance mechanisms may modify these targets to protect bacteria from the effects of antibiotics.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic target
antibiotic target

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cell wall biosynthesis provides bacteria with a layer of peptidoglycan that provides rigidity and protects the cell from lysis due to osmotic pressure. Cell wall structures vary significantly between Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, while mycobacteria have a unique cell wall composition.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cell wall synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cell wall biosynthesis provides bacteria with a layer of peptidoglycan that provides rigidity and protects the cell from lysis due to osmotic pressure. Cell wall structures vary significantly between Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, while mycobacteria have a unique cell wall composition.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Interaction with the cell membrane phospholipids interferes with membrane permeability and integrity, leading to the leakage of cell contents. The outer membrane of Gram-negative bacteria is particularly sensitive.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cell membrane component targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Interaction with the cell membrane phospholipids interferes with membrane permeability and integrity, leading to the leakage of cell contents. The outer membrane of Gram-negative bacteria is particularly sensitive.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Protein synthesis in bacteria is accomplished by cytosolic ribosomes that are structurally different from eukaryotic ribosomes, and thus a target for many antibiotics. By inhibiting ribosomal activity, either by directly binding to the ribosome or interacting with co-factors, antibiotics prevent protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: protein synthesis machinery targeted by antibiotic

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bacterial DNA and RNA synthesis includes many enzymes unique to bacteria that are targeted by antibiotics.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleic acid synthesis machinery targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bacterial DNA and RNA synthesis includes many enzymes unique to bacteria that are targeted by antibiotics.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Nucleic acids can also be targeted by antibiotics. These drugs are usually converted to an active form by enzymes unique to bacteria to prevent toxicity to the host.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleic acid targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Nucleic acids can also be targeted by antibiotics. These drugs are usually converted to an active form by enzymes unique to bacteria to prevent toxicity to the host.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Enzymes in the folate synthesis pathway are targeted by two main classes of antibiotics: sulfonamides and diaminopyrimidines. Inhibition of these enzymes block the production of key precursors for nucleotides and amino acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: folate synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Enzymes in the folate synthesis pathway are targeted by two main classes of antibiotics: sulfonamides and diaminopyrimidines. Inhibition of these enzymes block the production of key precursors for nucleotides and amino acids.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Enzymes in this pathway generate important precursors for macromolecules. While eukaryotes and prokaryotes both synthesize isoprenoids, many bacteria and notably mycobacteria use an alternative pathway that is targeted by antibiotics.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: isoprenoid synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Enzymes in this pathway generate important precursors for macromolecules. While eukaryotes and prokaryotes both synthesize isoprenoids, many bacteria and notably mycobacteria use an alternative pathway that is targeted by antibiotics.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Mycolic acids are produced by mycobacteria. These fatty acids are required for the construction of cell walls. Enzymes that are targeted by antibiotics include synthases, elongases, and dehydrogenases.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mycolic acid synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Mycolic acids are produced by mycobacteria. These fatty acids are required for the construction of cell walls. Enzymes that are targeted by antibiotics include synthases, elongases, and dehydrogenases.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Signal peptidase I is a bacterial signal peptidase that cleaves signal peptides from translated proteins. These signal peptides direct proteins to their destination, and then must be cleaved in order to function.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive signal peptidase I

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Signal peptidase I is a bacterial signal peptidase that cleaves signal peptides from translated proteins. These signal peptides direct proteins to their destination, and then must be cleaved in order to function.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Isoprepnyl pyrophosphate removes a phosphate group that is added from the peptidoglycan subunit to permit its transfer across the cell membrane. The phosphate group must be removed before its incorporation into peptidoglycan macromolecules.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bacitracin sensitive isoprenyl pyrophosphate

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Isoprepnyl pyrophosphate removes a phosphate group that is added from the peptidoglycan subunit to permit its transfer across the cell membrane. The phosphate group must be removed before its incorporation into peptidoglycan macromolecules.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The acyl-D-alanyl-D-alanine group is found at the terminal end of the pentapeptide chains of peptidoglycan subunits. Antibiotics that bind to this group block the addition of subunits, inhibiting peptidoglycan synthesis. This group is most accessible in Gram-postive bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: acyl-D-alanyl-D-alanine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The acyl-D-alanyl-D-alanine group is found at the terminal end of the pentapeptide chains of peptidoglycan subunits. Antibiotics that bind to this group block the addition of subunits, inhibiting peptidoglycan synthesis. This group is most accessible in Gram-postive bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The cell wall is unique to bacteria and provides rigidity and protects the cell from lysis due to osmotic pressure. Its characteristic component is peptidoglycan, though cell wall structures vary significantly between Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, as well as mycobacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cell wall component targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The cell wall is unique to bacteria and provides rigidity and protects the cell from lysis due to osmotic pressure. Its characteristic component is peptidoglycan, though cell wall structures vary significantly between Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, as well as mycobacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Alanine racemase converts the natural L-alanine to the D-alanine required in the pentapeptide chains in peptidoglycan. It is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cycloserine sensitive alanine racemase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Alanine racemase converts the natural L-alanine to the D-alanine required in the pentapeptide chains in peptidoglycan. It is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: D-Alanine synthetase joins two D-alanines before their addition to the pentapeptide chains of peptidoglycan. It is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cycloserine sensitive D-alanine synthetase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: D-Alanine synthetase joins two D-alanines before their addition to the pentapeptide chains of peptidoglycan. It is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pyruvyl transferase is responsible for the conversion of N-acetylglucosamine (NAG) to N-acetylmuramic acid (NAMA). NAMA is a part of the macromolecular backbone of peptidoglycans. Pyruvyl transferase is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fosfomycin sensitive pyruvyl transferase (murA)

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pyruvyl transferase is responsible for the conversion of N-acetylglucosamine (NAG) to N-acetylmuramic acid (NAMA). NAMA is a part of the macromolecular backbone of peptidoglycans. Pyruvyl transferase is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabanan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive arabinosyltransferase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabanan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The pentaglycyl bridge is part of Gram-positive peptidoglycan, allowing the formation of a thick and rigid cell wall.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pentaglycyl bridge

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The pentaglycyl bridge is part of Gram-positive peptidoglycan, allowing the formation of a thick and rigid cell wall.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The larger of two ribosomal subunits that make up the 70S bacterial ribosome.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: 50S ribosomal subunit

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The larger of two ribosomal subunits that make up the 70S bacterial ribosome.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The smaller of two ribosomal subunits that make up the 70S bacterial ribosome.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: 30S ribosomal subunit

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The smaller of two ribosomal subunits that make up the 70S bacterial ribosome.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The ribosomal complex can be targeted by antibiotics that stabilize the entire complex and prevent further translation. These antibiotics target both subunits in the process of protein translation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ribosomal complex

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The ribosomal complex can be targeted by antibiotics that stabilize the entire complex and prevent further translation. These antibiotics target both subunits in the process of protein translation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Elongation factor G (EF-G) provides energy for the translocation step in protein synthesis. Antibiotics that target EF-G allow one round of translocation but prevent EF-G from dissociating from the ribosome-RNA complex.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: elongation factor G

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Elongation factor G (EF-G) provides energy for the translocation step in protein synthesis. Antibiotics that target EF-G allow one round of translocation but prevent EF-G from dissociating from the ribosome-RNA complex.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Elongation factor Tu is required for peptide elongation in bacterial protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: elongation factor Tu

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Elongation factor Tu is required for peptide elongation in bacterial protein synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Isoleucyl-tRNA transferase recognizes isoleucine codons and works with the ribosome to incorporate isoleucine amino acids into polypeptide chains. It can be targeted by antibiotics that have an analog of isoleucine through competitive inhibition.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive Isoleucyl-tRNA transferase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Isoleucyl-tRNA transferase recognizes isoleucine codons and works with the ribosome to incorporate isoleucine amino acids into polypeptide chains. It can be targeted by antibiotics that have an analog of isoleucine through competitive inhibition.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the alpha-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fluoroquinolone sensitive gyrA

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the alpha-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the beta-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive DNA topoisomerase subunit gyrB

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the beta-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: subunit of the DNA topoisomerase IV sensitive to fluoroquinolone
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fluoroquinolone sensitive parC

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: subunit of the DNA topoisomerase IV sensitive to fluoroquinolone

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The rho transcription terminator factor moves along RNA as it is transcribed, unwinding the RNA from the DNA. It is also responsible for recognizing transcription termination pause sites, slowing down RNA polymerase and allowing mRNA to be released.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rho transcription terminator factor

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The rho transcription terminator factor moves along RNA as it is transcribed, unwinding the RNA from the DNA. It is also responsible for recognizing transcription termination pause sites, slowing down RNA polymerase and allowing mRNA to be released.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The beta-subunit of RNA polymerase is targeted as a complex. When blocked, RNA strand elongation cannot continue after the first few nucleotides.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rifamycin sensitive beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The beta-subunit of RNA polymerase is targeted as a complex. When blocked, RNA strand elongation cannot continue after the first few nucleotides.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Antibiotics can target DNA to cause strand breaks or prevent transcription. The activity of these antibiotics can be context dependent: some antibiotics are converted to an active form only in certain species, while others target DNA as it is being transcribed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: deoxyribonucleic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Antibiotics can target DNA to cause strand breaks or prevent transcription. The activity of these antibiotics can be context dependent: some antibiotics are converted to an active form only in certain species, while others target DNA as it is being transcribed.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: RNA intron self-splicing action can be inhibited by antibiotics that target a G-binding site to compete with the guanosine cofactor.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA guanosine binding site

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: RNA intron self-splicing action can be inhibited by antibiotics that target a G-binding site to compete with the guanosine cofactor.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Many types of ribonucleic acids (RNAs) are targeted by antibiotics, including mRNA templates and ribosomal RNA. Some antibiotics target all RNAs and cause strand breaks.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ribonucleic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Many types of ribonucleic acids (RNAs) are targeted by antibiotics, including mRNA templates and ribosomal RNA. Some antibiotics target all RNAs and cause strand breaks.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: DNA in the transcriptional complex is partially unwound, allowing antibiotics to target exposed bases and prevent DNA transcription.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcription complex DNA

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA in the transcriptional complex is partially unwound, allowing antibiotics to target exposed bases and prevent DNA transcription.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: DNA in anaerobes are targeted by antibiotics that are converted to an active form in the anaerobe environment. For nitroimidazoles, the antibiotic is reduced to a highly oxidative intermediate that causes DNA oxidation and double-stranded breaks.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: anaerobe DNA

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA in anaerobes are targeted by antibiotics that are converted to an active form in the anaerobe environment. For nitroimidazoles, the antibiotic is reduced to a highly oxidative intermediate that causes DNA oxidation and double-stranded breaks.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: This reductoisomerase is found in an alternate isoprenoid synthase pathway that is mevalonate independent. Isoprenoids are important precursors to many other macromolecules. This non-mevalonate pathway is used by plants and most bacteria, including mycobacteria, but not eukaryotes, allowing for selectivea action. Staphylococcus aureus and some other Gram-positive bacteria use a mevalonate-dependent pathway, and are resistant against 1-deoxy-D-xylose 5-phosphate reductoisomerase inhibitors.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate reductoisomerase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: This reductoisomerase is found in an alternate isoprenoid synthase pathway that is mevalonate independent. Isoprenoids are important precursors to many other macromolecules. This non-mevalonate pathway is used by plants and most bacteria, including mycobacteria, but not eukaryotes, allowing for selectivea action. Staphylococcus aureus and some other Gram-positive bacteria use a mevalonate-dependent pathway, and are resistant against 1-deoxy-D-xylose 5-phosphate reductoisomerase inhibitors.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Dihydropteroate synthase catalyzes the conversion of p-aminobenzoic acid to dihydropteroic acid as part of the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthetic pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, and a precursor of many nucleotides and amino acids. Inhibiting dihydropteroate leads to slow cell death, as bacteria can survive on existing folate storages for a few generations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive dihydropteroate synthase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Dihydropteroate synthase catalyzes the conversion of p-aminobenzoic acid to dihydropteroic acid as part of the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthetic pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, and a precursor of many nucleotides and amino acids. Inhibiting dihydropteroate leads to slow cell death, as bacteria can survive on existing folate storages for a few generations.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Dihydrofolate reductase synthesizes the co-enzyme tetrahydrofolic acid, which is also an essential precursor in the de novo synthesis of the DNA nucleotide thymidine.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive dihydrofolate reductase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Dihydrofolate reductase synthesizes the co-enzyme tetrahydrofolic acid, which is also an essential precursor in the de novo synthesis of the DNA nucleotide thymidine.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) are responsible for transpeptidation, joining subunits to form peptidoglycan. They are numbered according to descending molecular weight, and may vary between species. These numbers represent the PBPs of E. coli. Inhibition of the larger PBPs responsible for transpeptidation (1-3) are lethal. Smaller PBPs (4-6) are involed in carboxypeptidation; inhibition of these is non-lethal.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta-lactam sensitive penicillin-binding protein

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) are responsible for transpeptidation, joining subunits to form peptidoglycan. They are numbered according to descending molecular weight, and may vary between species. These numbers represent the PBPs of E. coli. Inhibition of the larger PBPs responsible for transpeptidation (1-3) are lethal. Smaller PBPs (4-6) are involed in carboxypeptidation; inhibition of these is non-lethal.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The bacterial 23S rRNA, at the P site of the 50S subunit, has peptidyl transferase activity and is responsible for peptide synthesis and elongation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive peptidyl transferase (23S rRNA)

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The bacterial 23S rRNA, at the P site of the 50S subunit, has peptidyl transferase activity and is responsible for peptide synthesis and elongation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The 16S rRNA of the 30S ribosomal subunit helps to stabilize the aminoacyl-tRNAs for pairing with the mRNA codons. Some antibiotics (aminoglycosides) that target the 16S rRNA lead to mRNA misreading as well as premature termination. Other antibiotics (tetracyclines) that target the 16S rRNA prevent incoming charged-tRNAs from binding to the ribosome's A-site, stopping elongation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive 16S rRNA

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The 16S rRNA of the 30S ribosomal subunit helps to stabilize the aminoacyl-tRNAs for pairing with the mRNA codons. Some antibiotics (aminoglycosides) that target the 16S rRNA lead to mRNA misreading as well as premature termination. Other antibiotics (tetracyclines) that target the 16S rRNA prevent incoming charged-tRNAs from binding to the ribosome's A-site, stopping elongation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The P-site of the ribosome binds the peptidyl-tRNA with the growing polypeptide chain. Antibiotics that target the P-site block fMet-tRNA from entering, thus inhibiting peptide elongation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: 30S ribosomal subunit P-site

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The P-site of the ribosome binds the peptidyl-tRNA with the growing polypeptide chain. Antibiotics that target the P-site block fMet-tRNA from entering, thus inhibiting peptide elongation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The P-site of the ribosome binds the peptidyl-tRNA with the growing polypeptide chain, and is a common target for many antibiotics that inhibit the 50S ribosomal subunit. Some antibiotics (oxazolidinones) block the 50S subunit from interacting with the 30S subunit to prevent the formation of the ribosomal complex. Other antibiotics (thiostrepton) block the 50S subunit from interacting with elongation factors G and Tu (EF-G, Ef-Tu), preventing GTP-dependent reactions of peptidyl transferase, and translocation, respectively. Other antibiotics (macrolides) prevent protein translocation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: 50S ribosomal subunit P-site

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The P-site of the ribosome binds the peptidyl-tRNA with the growing polypeptide chain, and is a common target for many antibiotics that inhibit the 50S ribosomal subunit. Some antibiotics (oxazolidinones) block the 50S subunit from interacting with the 30S subunit to prevent the formation of the ribosomal complex. Other antibiotics (thiostrepton) block the 50S subunit from interacting with elongation factors G and Tu (EF-G, Ef-Tu), preventing GTP-dependent reactions of peptidyl transferase, and translocation, respectively. Other antibiotics (macrolides) prevent protein translocation.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Fosmidomycin is an inhibitor of 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate reductoisomerase, an enzyme in the non-mevalonate pathway for isoprenoid synthesis. It is active against enterobacteria, but not against Gram-positive bacteria or anaerobes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fosmidomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Fosmidomycin is an inhibitor of 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate reductoisomerase, an enzyme in the non-mevalonate pathway for isoprenoid synthesis. It is active against enterobacteria, but not against Gram-positive bacteria or anaerobes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Fusidic acid is the only commercially available fusidane, a group of steroid-like antibiotics. It is most active against Gram-positive bacteria, and acts by inhibiting elongation factor G to block protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fusidic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Fusidic acid is the only commercially available fusidane, a group of steroid-like antibiotics. It is most active against Gram-positive bacteria, and acts by inhibiting elongation factor G to block protein synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cycloserine is an anti-mycobacterial agent, and is active against enterobacteria, streptococci, M. tuberculosis, Staphylococcus aureus, and many Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. It inhibits cell wall biosynthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cycloserine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cycloserine is an anti-mycobacterial agent, and is active against enterobacteria, streptococci, M. tuberculosis, Staphylococcus aureus, and many Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. It inhibits cell wall biosynthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Mecillinam is a broad-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic that was semi-synthetically derived to have a different drug centre, being a 6-alpha-amidinopenicillanate instead of a 6-alpha-acylaminopenicillanate. Contrasting most beta-lactam drugs, mecillinam is most active against Gram-negative bacteria. It binds specifically to penicillin binding protein 2 (PBP2).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mecillinam

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Mecillinam is a broad-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic that was semi-synthetically derived to have a different drug centre, being a 6-alpha-amidinopenicillanate instead of a 6-alpha-acylaminopenicillanate. Contrasting most beta-lactam drugs, mecillinam is most active against Gram-negative bacteria. It binds specifically to penicillin binding protein 2 (PBP2).

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pefloxacin is structurally and functionally similar to norfloxacin. It is poorly active against mycobacteria, while anaerobes are resistant.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pefloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pefloxacin is structurally and functionally similar to norfloxacin. It is poorly active against mycobacteria, while anaerobes are resistant.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: EmbC is an arabinosyltransferase involved in lipoarabinomannan synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive embC

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: EmbC is an arabinosyltransferase involved in lipoarabinomannan synthesis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: EmbA is an arabinosyltransferase that works as a heterodimer with EmbB. It is involved in the synthesis of arabinogalactan, a component of the mycobacterial cell wall.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive embA

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: EmbA is an arabinosyltransferase that works as a heterodimer with EmbB. It is involved in the synthesis of arabinogalactan, a component of the mycobacterial cell wall.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: EmbB is an arabinosyltransferase that works as a heterodimer with EmbA. It is involved in the synthesis of arabinogalactan, a component of the mycobacterial cell wall.
