owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: EmbB is an arabinosyltransferase that works as a heterodimer with EmbA. It is involved in the synthesis of arabinogalactan, a component of the mycobacterial cell wall.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Topoisomerases are responsible for winding and relaxing supercoiled DNA. The subunits of gyrase (gyrA, gyrB) and topoisomerase IV (parC, parE, parY) are targeted by antibiotics.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive topoisomerase subunit

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Avoparcin is a glycopeptide antibiotic that is an analog of vancomycin. It was formally used to treat animals, but has since been banned because of its selection for vancomycin-resistant enterococci.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: avoparcin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Avoparcin is a glycopeptide antibiotic that is an analog of vancomycin. It was formally used to treat animals, but has since been banned because of its selection for vancomycin-resistant enterococci.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Oleandomycin is a 14-membered macrolide produced by Streptomyces antibioticus. It is ssimilar to erythromycin, and contains a desosamine amino sugar and an oleandrose sugar. It targets the 50S ribosomal subunit to prevent protein synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: oleandomycin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Triclosan is a common antibacterial agent added to many consumer products as a biocide. It is an inhibitor of fatty acid biosynthesis by blocking enoyl-carrier protein reductase (FabI).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: triclosan

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Triclosan is a common antibacterial agent added to many consumer products as a biocide. It is an inhibitor of fatty acid biosynthesis by blocking enoyl-carrier protein reductase (FabI).

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Antibiotics can target bacteria-specific fatty acid biosynthesis enzymes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fatty acid synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Antibiotics can target bacteria-specific fatty acid biosynthesis enzymes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Enoyl-acyl carrier reductases catalyze the final enoyl reduction step in bacterial type II fatty acid elongation. Triclosan antibiotics block enoyl reduction and therefore fatty acid synthesis, functioning as a broad spectrum biocide and antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive enoyl-acyl carrier reductase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Enoyl-acyl carrier reductases catalyze the final enoyl reduction step in bacterial type II fatty acid elongation. Triclosan antibiotics block enoyl reduction and therefore fatty acid synthesis, functioning as a broad spectrum biocide and antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Elfamycins are molecules that inhibit bacterial elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu), a key protein which brings aminoacyl-tRNA (aa-tRNA) to the ribosome during protein synthesis. Elfamycins defined by their target (EF-Tu), rather than a conserved chemical backbone. Elfamycins follow two mechanisms to disrupt protein synthesis: 1. kirromycins and enacyloxin fix EF-Tu in the GTP bound conformation and lock EF-Tu onto the ribosome, and 2. pulvomycin and GE2270 cover the binding site of aa-tRNA disallowing EF-Tu from being charged with aa-tRNA. All elfamycins cause increased the affinity of EF-Tu for GTP.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: elfamycin antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Elfamycins are molecules that inhibit bacterial elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu), a key protein which brings aminoacyl-tRNA (aa-tRNA) to the ribosome during protein synthesis. Elfamycins defined by their target (EF-Tu), rather than a conserved chemical backbone. Elfamycins follow two mechanisms to disrupt protein synthesis: 1. kirromycins and enacyloxin fix EF-Tu in the GTP bound conformation and lock EF-Tu onto the ribosome, and 2. pulvomycin and GE2270 cover the binding site of aa-tRNA disallowing EF-Tu from being charged with aa-tRNA. All elfamycins cause increased the affinity of EF-Tu for GTP.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Factumycin is a kirromycin-like antibiotic produced by Kitasatospora setae and Streptomyces strains. Its biosynthetic cluster has been characterized which has interesting acetyl transferase domains in trans, or outside of the polyketide synthase domains. Factumycin has specific, rather than broad spectrum, antibacterial properties, especially targeting various Acinetobacter baumanii strains.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: factumycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Factumycin is a kirromycin-like antibiotic produced by Kitasatospora setae and Streptomyces strains. Factumycin has specific, rather than broad spectrum, antibacterial properties, especially targeting various Acinetobacter baumanii strains.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pikromycin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Kirromycin, also known as mocimycin, is the representative molecule of its own class of elfamycins which is composed of more than 10 analogs. Kirromycin binds to the domain 1,2 interface of elongation factor Tu. This interaction maintains the EF-Tu*GTP conformation even after GTP is hydrolyzed to GDP. EF-Tu*GDP normally releases aa-tRNA and then exits the ribosome; however, kirromycin*EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA forms a strong complex and remains bound to the ribosome, prohibits translocation of the peptide chain and translation is halted.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: kirromycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Kirromycin, also known as mocimycin, is the representative molecule of its own class of elfamycins which is composed of more than 10 analogs. Kirromycin binds to the domain 1,2 interface of elongation factor Tu. This interaction maintains the EF-Tu*GTP conformation even after GTP is hydrolyzed to GDP. EF-Tu*GDP normally releases aa-tRNA and then exits the ribosome; however, kirromycin*EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA forms a strong complex and remains bound to the ribosome, prohibits translocation of the peptide chain and translation is halted.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Aurodox is an elongation factor Tu inhibiting antibiotic. It was first referred to as X-5108. It is produced by Streptomyces goldiniensis var. goldiniensis and is active primarily against gram-positive bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: aurodox

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Aurodox is an elongation factor Tu inhibiting antibiotic. It was first referred to as X-5108. It is produced by Streptomyces goldiniensis var. goldiniensis and is active primarily against gram-positive bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Efrotomycin is produced by Streptomyces lactamodurans NRRL 3802. This kirromycin-like antibiotic is used in animal agriculture, especially in the production of swine. Generally gram negative bacteria are susceptible to efrotomycin, while gram positive bacteria are resistant.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: efrotomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Efrotomycin is produced by Streptomyces lactamodurans NRRL 3802. This kirromycin-like antibiotic is used in animal agriculture, especially in the production of swine. owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: GE2270A is the model molecule of cyclic thiazolyl peptide elfamycins. GE2270A is produced by Planobispora rosea. Biosynthesis of the molecule has been shown to originate as a ribosomally synthesized peptide that undergoes significant post-translational modification. Clinical use of cyclic thiazolyl peptides is hindered by their low water solubility and bioavailability.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: GE2270A

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: GE2270A is the model molecule of cyclic thiazolyl peptide elfamycins. GE2270A is produced by Planobispora rosea. Biosynthesis of the molecule has been shown to originate as a ribosomally synthesized peptide that undergoes significant post-translational modification. Clinical use of cyclic thiazolyl peptides is hindered by their low water solubility and bioavailability.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Enacyloxin IIa is structurally distinct but acts in a similar mechanism to kirromycin-like elfamycins. It prohibits the transfer of the amino acid at the A site to the elongating peptide chain. It is most likely that the mechanism of action is that EF-Tu*GDP is locked in the EF-Tu*GTP form, and EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA is immobilized on the ribosome. It is an open question whether enacyloxin IIa actually belongs to the kirromycin-like group of elfamycins due to their high similarity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: enacyloxin IIa

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Enacyloxin IIa is structurally distinct but acts in a similar mechanism to kirromycin-like elfamycins. It prohibits the transfer of the amino acid at the A site to the elongating peptide chain. It is most likely that the mechanism of action is that EF-Tu*GDP is locked in the EF-Tu*GTP form, and EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA is immobilized on the ribosome. It is an open question whether enacyloxin IIa actually belongs to the kirromycin-like group of elfamycins due to their high similarity.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Kirrothricin is produced by Streptomyces cinnamoneus and is structurally related to kirromycin, aurodox, heneicomycin and shares a similar spectrum of antibacterial activity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: kirrothricin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Kirrothricin is produced by Streptomyces cinnamoneus and is structurally related to kirromycin, aurodox, heneicomycin and shares a similar spectrum of antibacterial activity.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Phenelfamycin A was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin A has a monosaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin B. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridioides difficile.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: SB22484 antibiotics are of the same chemical group as kirromycins. SB22484 antibiotics are produced by Streptomyces sp. NRRL 15496. owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: UK-69,753 is a glycosylated form of factumycin. UK-69,753 has been shown to have strong in vitro and in vivo activity toward a swine pathogen, Treponema hyodysenteriae.

Phenelfamycin G and H are isomeric and similar to phenelfamycin E and F only with the addition of a hydroxyl group at position C-30. Phenelfamycin G and H have a narrow antibacterial spectrum with potent activity against Cutibacterium acnes.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: One of a small group of kirromycin-like elfamycins which lack the pyridone moiety. Ganefromycin is produced by Streptomyces lydicus spp. tanzanius, and was considered for use as a growth promoting antibiotic in agriculture.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ganefromycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: One of a small group of kirromycin-like elfamycins which lack the pyridone moiety. Ganefromycin is produced by Streptomyces lydicus spp. tanzanius, and was considered for use as a growth promoting antibiotic in agriculture.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Precursor molecule during the synthesis of bacterial cell wall. Lipid II anchors itself onto the cell and it's disaccharide-peptide subunit is used in PG polymer assembly by peptidoglycan glycosyltransferases. Due to it's importance in cell wall synthesis, it is the target of antibiotics.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Lipid II

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Precursor molecule during the synthesis of bacterial cell wall. Lipid II anchors itself onto the cell and it's disaccharide-peptide subunit is used in PG polymer assembly by peptidoglycan glycosyltransferases. Due to it's importance in cell wall synthesis, it is the target of antibiotics.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Lipid III is the precursor to the wall teichoic acid. It's inhibition leads to bacterial death as teichoic acid is required to anchor autolysins which control the hydrolysis of peptidoglycan cell wall.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Lipid III

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Lipid III is the precursor to the wall teichoic acid. It's inhibition leads to bacterial death as teichoic acid is required to anchor autolysins which control the hydrolysis of peptidoglycan cell wall.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Teixobactin is a peptide antibiotic isolated from the Gram-negative bacteria, Eleftheria terrae. It inhibits the synthesis of peptidoglycan by interacting with peptidoglycan precursor, Lipid II and Lipid III.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: teixobactin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Teixobactin is a peptide antibiotic isolated from the Gram-negative bacteria, Eleftheria terrae. It inhibits the synthesis of peptidoglycan by interacting with peptidoglycan precursor, Lipid II and Lipid III.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Undecaprenyl pyrophosphate is a precursor to a cell wall polymer carrier. It's activation requires a phosphatase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: undecaprenyl pyrophosphate

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the alpha-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the alpha-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Interaction with the cell membrane phospholipids interferes with membrane permeability and integrity, leading to the leakage of cell contents. The outer membrane of Gram-negative bacteria is particularly sensitive.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cardiolipin synthetase catalyzes the formation of cardiolipin from two phosphatidylglycerol molecules. Cardiolipin is important in membrane translocation and permeabilization. The inactivation of this enzyme by antibiotics leads to cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive cls

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cardiolipin synthetase catalyzes the formation of cardiolipin from two phosphatidylglycerol molecules. Cardiolipin is important in membrane translocation and permeabilization. Mutations on the enzyme confers resistance to Daptomycin
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Daptomycin sensitive cardiolipin synthetase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cardiolipin synthetase catalyzes the formation of cardiolipin from two phosphatidylglycerol molecules. Cardiolipin is important in membrane translocation and permeabilization. Mutations on the enzyme confers resistance to Daptomycin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: RNA polymerase is a multisubunit enzyme that is necessary for transcription. The beta-subunit of RNA polymerase forms the active center of the enzyme and template/transcript binding sites. This enzyme can be inactivated by antibiotics leading to cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Daptomycin binds to the cytoplasmic membrane of Gram-positive. It's lipopeptide tail servers as a ion channel for potassium. This causes a rapid depolarization that result in failures in DNA/RNA/Protein synthesis. Eventually cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: daptomycin sensitive beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Daptomycin binds to the cytoplasmic membrane of Gram-positive. It's lipopeptide tail servers as a ion channel for potassium. This causes a rapid depolarization that result in failures in DNA/RNA/Protein synthesis. Eventually cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface of both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins. Mutations in this enzyme can confer additional resistances.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive mprF

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface of both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: pgsA or phosphatidylglycerophosphate synthetase is an integral membrane protein involved in phospholipid biosynthesis. Inhibition of this enzyme leads to cell death via the inability to form the plasma membrane.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive pgsA

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: pgsA or phosphatidylglycerophosphate synthetase is an integral membrane protein involved in phospholipid biosynthesis. Inhibition of this enzyme leads to cell death via the inability to form the plasma membrane.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A sulfone active against a wide range of bacteria but mainly employed for its actions against mycobacterium laprae. Its mechanism of action involves inhibition of folic acid synthesis in susceptible organisms.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sulfone antibiotic

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Dapsone is a sulfone in which it inhibits folic acid synthesis, such as the dihydropteroate synthase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: dapsone

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Pyrazinamide is an Antimycobacterial. It is highly specific and active only against Mycobacterium tuberculosis. This compound is a prodrug and needs to be activated inside the cell. It interferes with the bacterium's ability to synthesize new fatty acids, causing cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pyrazinamide

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: LFF571 is a novel semi-synthetic thiopeptide antibiotic derived from GE2270. It has been shown to possess potent in vitro and in vivo activity against Gram-positive bacteria. It is hypothesized that it a translation inhibitor leading to cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LFF571

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: LFF571 is a novel semi-synthetic thiopeptide antibiotic derived from GE2270. It has been shown to possess potent in vitro and in vivo activity against Gram-positive bacteria. It is hypothesized that it a translation inhibitor leading to cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: ParE is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, necessary for cell survival. Point mutations in ParE prevent fluoroquinolones from inhibiting DNA synthesis, thus conferring resistance.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ribosomal protein S12 stabilizes the highly conserved pseudoknot structure formed by 16S rRNA. It is targeted and inhibited by streptomycin
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive Ribosomal protein S12 (rpsL)

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The switch region is a structural element that mediates conformational changes and contacts required for RNAP to load DNA into the RNAP active-center cleft during transcription initiation. The switch region is located at the base of the RNAP clamp and serves as the hinge that mediates opening of the RNAP clamp to load DNA into the RNAP active-center cleft and mediates closing of the RNAP clamp to retain DNA in the RNAP active-center cleft.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Plazomicin is a neoglycoside, or next-generation, aminoglycoside, that has been identified as a potentially useful agent to combat drug-resistant bacteria, such as Acinetobacter baumannii and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: plazomicin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Sitafloxacin is a fluoroquinolone active against multi-resistant Gram-positive and negative pathogens. Sitafloxacin shows inhibitory activity against DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV, which blocks bacterial DNA replication, thereby causing double-stranded breaks in the bacterial chromosome.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sitafloxacin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Rokitamycin is a macrolide antibiotic. Synthesized from strains of Streptomyces kitasatoensis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rokitamycin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Penems are a class of unsaturated beta-lactam antibiotics with a broad spectrum of antibacterial activity and have a structure which renders them highly resistant to beta-lactamases. All penems are all synthetically made and act by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. They are structurally similar to carbapenems, however, where carbapenems have a carbon, penems have a sulfur.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: penem

They are structurally similar to carbapenems, however, where carbapenems have a carbon, penems have a sulfur.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: faropenem

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Faropenem is an orally active beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the penem group.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Panipenem is a carbapenem antibacterial agent with a broad spectrum of in vitro activity covering a wide range of Gram-negative and Gram-positive aerobic and anaerobic bacterial. It is used in combination with betamipron to inhibit panipenem uptake into the renal tubule and prevent nephrotoxicity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: panipenem

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Panipenem is a carbapenem antibacterial agent with a broad spectrum of in vitro activity covering a wide range of Gram-negative and Gram-positive aerobic and anaerobic bacterial. owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A heterocyclic antibiotic that targets mutant gyrA (type II topoisomerase) containing an S84L substitution, counteracting acquired quinolone resistance. It is effective against quinolone-resistant Gram-positive bacteria including S. aureus and E. faecalis. Due to its ability to counteract quinolone resistance by targeting the mutant form of the gyrA protein, it is classified as a reverse antibiotic (RA).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nybomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A heterocyclic antibiotic that targets mutant gyrA (type II topoisomerase) containing an S84L substitution, counteracting acquired quinolone resistance. owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: BAL30072 is a monocyclic beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the sulfactams. BAL30072 was found to trigger the spheroplasting and lysis of Escherichia coli rather than the formation of extensive filaments.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BAL30072

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: BAL30072 is a monocyclic beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the sulfactams. BAL30072 was found to trigger the spheroplasting and lysis of Escherichia coli rather than the formation of extensive filaments.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Battacin is a cationic lipopeptide antibiotic produced from a Paenibacillus tianmuensis soil isolate. Battacin kills bacteria in vitro and has potent activity against Gram-negative bacteria, including multidrug-resistant and extremely drug-resistant clinical isolates. The bactericidal kinetics of battacin correlate with the depolarization of the cell membrane, suggesting that battacin kills bacteria by disrupting the cytoplasmic membrane.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: battacin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Benzalkonium chloride is a type of cationic surfactant. It is an organic salt called a quaternary ammonium compound. It has three main categories of use: as a biocide, a cationic surfactant, and as a phase transfer agent.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Temocillin is a beta-lactamase resistant carboxypenicillin. It is primarily used for the treatment of multiple drug resistant, Gram-negative bacteria, specifically Enterobacteriaceae.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: temocillin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Temocillin is a beta-lactamase resistant carboxypenicillin. It is primarily used for the treatment of multiple drug resistant, Gram-negative bacteria, specifically Enterobacteriaceae.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ticarcillin is a carboxypenicillin used for the treatment of Gram-negative bacteria, particularly P. aeruginosa. Ticarcillin's antibiotic properties arise from its ability to prevent cross-linking of peptidoglycan during cell wall synthesis, when the bacteria try to divide, causing cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ticarcillin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Tedizolid is a synthetic oxazolidinone antibiotic that is administered to the patient as a prodrug that is activated in vivo. owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: a 5th generation cephalosporin antibiotic
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ceftolozane

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: a aminomethylcycline antibiotic that targets 16s rRNA in gram positive and gram negative bacteria
owl:Class.rdfs:label: omadacycline

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: microcin J25 is a peptide antibiotic that inhibits transcription by bacterial RNA polymerase. MccJ25 is produced by Escherichia coli strains that harbor a plasmid-borne antibiotic-synthesis and antibiotic-export cassette, consisting of a gene for MccJ25 precursor (a 58 residue linear peptide), two genes for factors that process MccJ25 precursor into MccJ25, and one gene for export of MccJ25.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: microcin J25

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: microcin J25 is a peptide antibiotic that inhibits transcription by bacterial RNA polymerase. MccJ25 is produced by Escherichia coli strains that harbor a plasmid-borne antibiotic-synthesis and antibiotic-export cassette, consisting of a gene for MccJ25 precursor (a 58 residue linear peptide), two genes for factors that process MccJ25 precursor into MccJ25, and one gene for export of MccJ25.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Amongst the diverse and potent biological activities of free fatty acids (FFAs) is the ability to kill or inhibit the growth of bacteria. The antibacterial properties of FFAs are used by many organisms to defend against parasitic or pathogenic bacteria. The prime target of FFA action is the cell membrane, where FFAs disrupt the electron transport chain and oxidative phosphorylation. Besides interfering with cellular energy production, FFA action may also result from the inhibition of enzyme activity, impairment of nutrient uptake, generation of peroxidation and auto-oxidation degradation products or direct lysis of bacterial cells.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibacterial free fatty acids

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Amongst the diverse and potent biological activities of free fatty acids (FFAs) is the ability to kill or inhibit the growth of bacteria. The antibacterial properties of FFAs are used by many organisms to defend against parasitic or pathogenic bacteria. The prime target of FFA action is the cell membrane, where FFAs disrupt the electron transport chain and oxidative phosphorylation. Besides interfering with cellular energy production, FFA action may also result from the inhibition of enzyme activity, impairment of nutrient uptake, generation of peroxidation and auto-oxidation degradation products or direct lysis of bacterial cells.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Palmitic acid is the most common saturated fatty acid found in animals, plants, and microorganisms. Palmitic acid is found to have antibacterial properties.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: palmitic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Palmitic acid is the most common saturated fatty acid found in animals, plants, and microorganisms. Palmitic acid is found to have antibacterial properties.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Oleic acid is a fatty acid that occurs naturally in various animal and vegetable fats and oils. Oleic acid is found to have antibacterial activity, particularly in inhibiting the growth of several Gram-positive bacterial species.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: oleic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Oleic acid is a fatty acid that occurs naturally in various animal and vegetable fats and oils. Oleic acid is found to have antibacterial activity, particularly in inhibiting the growth of several Gram-positive bacterial species.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Linoleic acid is a polyunsaturated omega-6 fatty acid. Linoleic acid has been found to have antibacterial activity, particularly in inhibiting the growth of Gram-positive bacterial species.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: linoleic acid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Linoleic acid is a polyunsaturated omega-6 fatty acid. Linoleic acid has been found to have antibacterial activity, particularly in inhibiting the growth of Gram-positive bacterial species.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A clinically developed Macrolide antibiotic targeting gram positive and gram negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Solithromycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A clinically developed Macrolide antibiotic targeting gram positive and gram negative bacteria.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Antibiotic produced by Streptomyces pactum, considered a universal translation inhibitor
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pactamycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Antibiotic produced by Streptomyces pactum, considered a universal translation inhibitor

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A fluorocycline that acts to inhibit the bacterial ribosome.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Eravacycline

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A fluorocycline that acts to inhibit the bacterial ribosome.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Capreomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic, capable of treating a large number of infections but in particular used for killing bacteria causing tuberculosis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: capreomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Capreomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic, capable of treating a large number of infections but in particular used for killing bacteria causing tuberculosis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An antibiotic cocktail containing the beta-lactam antibiotic Amoxicillin and the beta-lactamase inhibitor Clavulanic Acid (potassium clavulanate).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: amoxicillin-clavulanic acid

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An antibiotic mixture containing the penicillin-derived beta-lactam antibiotic Ampicillin and the beta-lactamase inhibitor Sulbactam. Also known as Unasyn and/or Ampictam.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ampicillin-sulbactam

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefamandole is a second-generation cephalosporin-class beta-lactam antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefamandole

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefetamet is a third-generation semi-synthetic beta-lactam antibiotic that inactivates inner cell wall PBPs through targeting binding, resulting in cell lysis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefetamet

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefetamet is a third-generation semi-synthetic beta-lactam antibiotic that inactivates inner cell wall PBPs through targeting binding, resulting in cell lysis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefmetazole is a semi-synthetic cephamycin antibiotic with broad spectrum antibiotic activity against both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, that disrupt cell wall synthesis through binding to PBPs causing cell lysis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefmetazole

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefonicid is a second-generation cephalosporin-class beta-lactam antibiotic with broad spectrum activity. Particularly used against urinary tract infections and lower respiratory infections. Causes cell lysis by inactivation of PBPs through binding, inhibiting peptidoglycan synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefonicid

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefoperazone is a semi-synthetic cephalosporin containing a tetrazolyl moiety that is resistant to beta-lactamases. Particularly used for treatment of Pseudomonas spp. infections.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefoperazone

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefoperazone is a semi-synthetic cephalosporin containing a tetrazolyl moiety that is resistant to beta-lactamases. Particularly used for treatment of Pseudomonas spp. infections.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefotetan is a cephamycin-class beta-lactam antibiotic that is highly resistant to beta-lactamases and effective against a wide range of gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefotetan

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefprozil is a cephalosporin and beta-lactam antibiotic with bactericidal activity. It selectively binds to PBPs and inhibits peptidoglycan synthesis, a major cell wall component, resulting in cell lysis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefprozil

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefprozil is a cephalosporin and beta-lactam antibiotic with bactericidal activity. It selectively binds to PBPs and inhibits peptidoglycan synthesis, a major cell wall component, resulting in cell lysis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ceftiofur is a third-generation broad spectrum cephalosporin and beta-lactam antibiotic. It causes cell lysis by disrupting peptidoglycan cross-linkage and cell wall formation by binding to PBPs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ceftiofur

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ceftiofur is a third-generation broad spectrum cephalosporin and beta-lactam antibiotic. It causes cell lysis by disrupting peptidoglycan cross-linkage and cell wall formation by binding to PBPs.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Ceftizoxime is a third-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Ceftizoxime causes bacterial cell lysis through peptidoglycan cross-linking inhibition by binding to PBPs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ceftizoxime

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ceftizoxime is a third-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Ceftizoxime causes bacterial cell lysis through peptidoglycan cross-linking inhibition by binding to PBPs.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cephapirin is a first-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Inactivation of penicillin-binding proteins through cephapirin binding disrupts peptidoglycan cross-linking, resulting in cell lysis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cephapirin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cefradine is a first-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Cefradine binding to penicillin-binding proteins disrupts cell wall peptidoglycan cross-linkage, resulting in cell lysis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefradine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cefradine is a first-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Cefradine binding to penicillin-binding proteins disrupts cell wall peptidoglycan cross-linkage, resulting in cell lysis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cinoxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic primarily used for the treatment of urinary tract infections in adults. Cinoxacin binds to DNA gyrase, resulting in double-stranded DNA breaks and cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cinoxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cinoxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic primarily used for the treatment of urinary tract infections in adults. Cinoxacin binds to DNA gyrase, resulting in double-stranded DNA breaks and cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Clinafloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic and gyrase (DNA topoisomerase II) inhibitor. It binds to DNA gyrase and disrupts replication by causing double-stranded DNA breaks, resulting in cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: clinafloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Clinafloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic and gyrase (DNA topoisomerase II) inhibitor. It binds to DNA gyrase and disrupts replication by causing double-stranded DNA breaks, resulting in cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Clofazimine is a fluoroquinolone-class phenazine dye used for the treatment of leprosy. Clofazimine binds to DNA and disrupts bacterial DNA gyrase, thereby causing double-stranded DNA breaks, and subsequent cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Clofazimine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Clofazimine is a fluoroquinolone-class phenazine dye used for the treatment of leprosy. Clofazimine binds to DNA and disrupts bacterial DNA gyrase, thereby causing double-stranded DNA breaks, and subsequent cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Fleroxacin is a broad spectrum fluoroquinolone antibiotic that inhibits the DNA supercoiling activity of bacterial DNA gyrase, resulting in double-stranded DNA breaks and subsequent cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fleroxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Fleroxacin is a broad spectrum fluoroquinolone antibiotic that inhibits the DNA supercoiling activity of bacterial DNA gyrase, resulting in double-stranded DNA breaks and subsequent cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Flomoxef is a second-generation cephamycin (oxacephem) and beta-lactam antibiotic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: flomoxef

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Flomoxef is a second-generation cephamycin (oxacephem) and beta-lactam antibiotic.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Gentamicin A is part of a complex of broad spectrum aminoglycoside antibiotics. Gentamicin inhibits protein synthesis, resulting in bacterial cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gentamicin A

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Gentamicin A is part of a complex of broad spectrum aminoglycoside antibiotics. Gentamicin inhibits protein synthesis, resulting in bacterial cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Loracarbef is a second-generation cephalosporin (carbacephem) and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Loracarbef inhibits PBPs through binding, disrupting peptidoglycan cell wall cross-linkage and resulting in cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: loracarbef

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Loracarbef is a second-generation cephalosporin (carbacephem) and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Loracarbef inhibits PBPs through binding, disrupting peptidoglycan cell wall cross-linkage and resulting in cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Moxalactam (Latamoxef) is a broad spectrum cephalosporin (oxacephem) and beta-lactam antibiotic. Moxalactam binding to PBPs inhibits peptidoglycan cross-linkage in the cell wall, resulting in cell death. Moxalactam is proposed to be effective against meningitides as it passes the blood-brain barrier.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: moxalactam

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Moxalactam (Latamoxef) is a broad spectrum cephalosporin (oxacephem) and beta-lactam antibiotic. Moxalactam binding to PBPs inhibits peptidoglycan cross-linkage in the cell wall, resulting in cell death. Moxalactam is proposed to be effective against meningitides as it passes the blood-brain barrier.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Nafcillin is a penicillin-class narrow-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. It inhibits cell wall synthesis and peptidoglycan cross-linkage through binding to PBPs, similarly to other penicillin-like antibiotics.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nafcillin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: para-aminosalicylic acid (PAS) is an anti-tubercular antibiotic agent, often used in conjunction with Isoniazid for treatment of M. tuberculosis infections. PAS diminishes bacterial cell growth by limiting folic acid production.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: para-aminosalicylic acid

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An antibiotic cocktail containing the beta-lactam penam antibiotic Piperacillin and the beta-lactamase inhibitor sulbactam.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: piperacillin-sulbactam

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An antibiotic cocktail containing the penam beta-lactam antibiotic Piperacillin and the beta-lactamase inhibitor Tazobactam.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: piperacillin-tazobactam

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An antibiotic cocktail of the streptogramin A dalfopristin and the streptogramin B quinupristin antibiotics. Used particularly to treat MRSA and vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: quinupristin-dalfopristin

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An antibiotic cocktail containing the beta-lactam antibiotic ticarcillin and the beta-lactamase inhibitor clavulanic acid (clavulanate).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ticarcillin-clavulanic acid

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An antibiotic cocktail containing the diaminopyrimidine antibiotic Trimethoprim and the sulfonamide antibiotic sulfamethoxazole (1 TMP:5 SMX).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Prothionamide is a thioamide derivative with antibacterial properties. It increases cell wall permeability and decreases cell wall damage resistance by inhibition of mycolic acid synthesis, resulting in cell death. It is particularly used to treat M. tuberculosis and M. leprae infections.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prothionamide

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Prothionamide is a thioamide derivative with antibacterial properties. It increases cell wall permeability and decreases cell wall damage resistance by inhibition of mycolic acid synthesis, resulting in cell death. It is particularly used to treat M. tuberculosis and M. leprae infections.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Tinidazole is a nitroimidazole anti-parasitic drug. It is used in the treatment of protozoan infections.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tinidazole

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Tinidazole is a nitroimidazole anti-parasitic drug. It is used in the treatment of protozoan infections.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: fabI is a bacterial enoyl-acyl carrier reductase (ENR) isozyme. As with other ENRs, mutations in fabI can confer resistance to the biocide triclosan.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive fabI

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: fabG is a bacterial 3-oxoacyl enoyl-acyl carrier reductase (ENR) isozyme. As with other ENRs, mutations in fabG are shown to confer resistance to the biocide triclosan.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive fabG

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: fabG is a bacterial 3-oxoacyl enoyl-acyl carrier reductase (ENR) isozyme. As with other ENRs, mutations in fabG are shown to confer resistance to the biocide triclosan.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Lefamulin is a semi-synthetic pleuromutilin compound highly active against multi-resistant pathogens.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lefamulin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Lefamulin is a semi-synthetic pleuromutilin compound highly active against multi-resistant pathogens.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Nitroimidazoles are a group of drugs that have both antiprotozoal and antibacterial activity, classified with respect to the location of the nitro functional group.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nitroimidazole antibiotic

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Nitrofurans are chemotherapeutic agents with antibacterial and antiprotozoal activity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nitrofuran antibiotic

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: CBP C1-aminomethylene vancomycin is a synthetic vancomycin derivative which exhibits multiple synergistic mechanisms of action, allowing it to effectively inhibit otherwise-glycopeptide resistant Gram-positive bacteria (notably those with functioning VanA clusters).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CBP C1-aminomethylene vancomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: CBP C1-aminomethylene vancomycin is a synthetic vancomycin derivative which exhibits multiple synergistic mechanisms of action, allowing it to effectively inhibit otherwise-glycopeptide resistant Gram-positive bacteria (notably those with functioning VanA clusters).

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Bactericidal/permeability-increasing (BPI) protein is a member of a new generation of proteins known as super-antibiotics that are implicated as endotoxin neutralising agents. The potent (nM) cytotoxicity of BPI is limited to gram-negative bacteria (GNB), reflecting the high affinity (<10 nM) of BPI for bacterial lipopolysaccharides (LPS). Binding of BPI to live bacteria via LPS causes immediate growth arrest, actual killing coincides with later damage to the inner membrane.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BPI

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bactericidal/permeability-increasing (BPI) protein is a member of a new generation of proteins known as super-antibiotics that are implicated as endotoxin neutralising agents. The potent (nM) cytotoxicity of BPI is limited to gram-negative bacteria (GNB), reflecting the high affinity (<10 nM) of BPI for bacterial lipopolysaccharides (LPS). Binding of BPI to live bacteria via LPS causes immediate growth arrest, actual killing coincides with later damage to the inner membrane.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cephaloridine is a semisynthetic, broad-spectrum, first-generation cephalosporin with antibacterial activity. Cephaloridine binds to and inactivates penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) located on the inner membrane of the bacterial cell wall. PBPs are enzymes involved in the terminal stages of assembling the bacterial cell wall and in reshaping the cell wall during growth and division. Inactivation of PBPs interferes with the cross-linkage of peptidoglycan chains necessary for bacterial cell wall strength and rigidity. This results in the weakening of the bacterial cell wall and causes cell lysis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cephaloridine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Cephaloridine is a semisynthetic, broad-spectrum, first-generation cephalosporin with antibacterial activity. Cephaloridine binds to and inactivates penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) located on the inner membrane of the bacterial cell wall. PBPs are enzymes involved in the terminal stages of assembling the bacterial cell wall and in reshaping the cell wall during growth and division. Inactivation of PBPs interferes with the cross-linkage of peptidoglycan chains necessary for bacterial cell wall strength and rigidity. This results in the weakening of the bacterial cell wall and causes cell lysis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Balofloxacin is an 8-methoxy fluoroquinolone antibiotic. It shows potent bactericidal activity and inhibits the supercoiling activity of DNA gyrase of S. aureus, E. coli, and P. aeruginosa.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: balofloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Balofloxacin is an 8-methoxy fluoroquinolone antibiotic. It shows potent bactericidal activity and inhibits the supercoiling activity of DNA gyrase of S. aureus, E. coli, and P. aeruginosa.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Thymidylate synthase (synthetase) catalyzes the conversion of dUMP to dTMP in the nucleic acid biosynthesis pathway. Inhibition of thyA imbalances the cellular concentration of dUMP causing DNA damage.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive thymidylate synthase

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Thymidylate synthase (synthetase) catalyzes the conversion of dUMP to dTMP in the nucleic acid biosynthesis pathway. Inhibition of thyA imbalances the cellular concentration of dUMP causing DNA damage.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Wild-type form of dihydrofolate synthase (synthetase) enzymes. Bioactivation of p-aminosalicylic acid occurs during the folate pathway when dihydrofolate and its analog hydroxyl-dihydrofolate are produced by dihydrofolate synthase. Disruption of this pathway by PAS results in cell damage and death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: antibiotic sensitive dihydrofolate synthase

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A ribosomally synthesized cyclic peptide antibiotic. Lassomycin has been shown to be effective against drug-resistant mycobacteria but shows little activity against other bacteria. Lassomycin targets and binds to a region of the ClpC1 ATPase complex and uncouples ATPase from proteolytic activity, an essential function for mycobacterial viability, causing cell death.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lassomycin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A ribosomally synthesized cyclic peptide antibiotic. Lassomycin has been shown to be effective against drug-resistant mycobacteria but shows little activity against other bacteria. Lassomycin targets and binds to a region of the ClpC1 ATPase complex and uncouples ATPase from proteolytic activity, an essential function for mycobacterial viability, causing cell death.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A calcium-dependent cyclic lipopeptide found to be effective against multidrug-resistant Staphylococcus aureus in cutaneous wound infections.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: malacidin A

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A calcium-dependent cyclic lipopeptide found to be effective against multidrug-resistant Staphylococcus aureus in cutaneous wound infections.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Delafloxacin is a novel fluoroquinolone antibiotic, differentiated from other on-market fluoroquinolones by the absence of a protonatable substituent conferring a weakly acidic character to the molecule. This property results in increased intracellular penetration and enhanced bactericidal activity under acidic conditions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: delafloxacin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Delafloxacin is a novel fluoroquinolone antibiotic, differentiated from other on-market fluoroquinolones by the absence of a protonatable substituent conferring a weakly acidic character to the molecule. This property results in increased intracellular penetration and enhanced bactericidal activity under acidic conditions.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A carbapenem antibiotic, administered as the oral drug tebipenem-pivoxil, shown to be effective at treating bacterial infections.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tebipenem

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A carbapenem antibiotic, administered as the oral drug tebipenem-pivoxil, shown to be effective at treating bacterial infections.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A siderophore cephalosporin with antibiotic activity against Gram-negative pathogens including and specifically Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cefiderocol

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A siderophore cephalosporin with antibiotic activity against Gram-negative pathogens including and specifically Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Eremomycin pyrrolidide (5) is a semisynthetic glycopeptides 3-6 that is derived from vancomycin or eremomycin. It has high activity against staphylococci and enterococci, including vancomycin-resistant strains.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: eremomycin pyrrolidide

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Eremomycin pyrrolidide (5) is a semisynthetic glycopeptides 3-6 that is derived from vancomycin or eremomycin. It has high activity against staphylococci and enterococci, including vancomycin-resistant strains.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A novel nitroimidazole antibiotic for treating Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection. Delamanid inhibits bacterial cell wall growth by mycolic acid synthesis disruption and is particularly effective in combination therapies against multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: delamanid

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A novel nitroimidazole antibiotic for treating Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection. Delamanid inhibits bacterial cell wall growth by mycolic acid synthesis disruption and is particularly effective in combination therapies against multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A class of antibiotics used to treat specifically Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection; therefore, referred to as an antimycobacterial. Diarylquinoline antibiotics inhibit ATP synthesis in tuberculosis cells by disruption of mycobacterial ATP synthase.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: diarylquinoline antibiotic

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A class of antibiotics used to treat specifically Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection; therefore, referred to as an antimycobacterial. Diarylquinoline antibiotics inhibit ATP synthesis in tuberculosis cells by disruption of mycobacterial ATP synthase.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A diarylquinoline antibiotic drug sold under the brand name Sirturo, used to treat infection from Mycobacterium spp., particularly multidrug-resistant tuberculosis. Bedaquiline disrupts ATP synthase by proton pump blockage, inhibiting ATP synthesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bedaquiline

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Tosufloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic with an extended spectrum of activity.

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Rifalazil is a rifamycin derivative antibiotic, sometimes used for treating Clostridioides difficile infections.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Ramoplanin

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ramoplanin is a glycolipodepsipeptide antibiotic derived from gram-positive Actinoplanes used to treat infection with Clostridioides difficile

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ceftazidime-cloxacillin

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A gastrointestinal system disease described as the condition of having frequent loose or liquid bowel movements. Acute diarrhea is a common cause of death in developing countries and the second most common cause of infant deaths worldwide. The loss of fluids through diarrhea can cause severe dehydration which is one cause of death in diarrhea sufferers. Along with water, sufferers also lose dangerous amounts of important salts, electrolytes, and other nutrients. There are at least four types of diarrhea: secretory diarrhea, osmotic diarrhea, motility-related diarrhea, and inflammatory diarrhea.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: diarrhea
